resources.string:
AndroGoat is purposely developed open source vulnerable/insecure app using Kotlin. Security Testers/Professionals/Enthusiasts, Developers...etc. can use this application to understand and defend the vulnerabilities in Android platform. This is the first vulnerable app developed using Kotlin.
If you are looking to learn Android Application Security Testing then AndroGoat is a perfect solution. 
 ***Happy Learning***

Objectives: 
 1. Understand what is Rooting 
 2. How app can detect if device is Rooted? 
 3. Bypass Root Detection using 
 3.1 RootCloack 
 3.2 Repackaging 
 3.3 Frida 
 
 
 Click on 'Check Root' button"

Objectives: 
 1. Understand what is Emulator 
 2. How app can detect if device is Emulator? 
 3. Bypass Emulator Detection using 
 3.1 RootCloack 
 3.2 Repackaging 
 3.3 Frida 
 
 
 Click on 'Check Emulator' button"

Objectives: 
 1. What info is Logged 
 2. Vulnerable Code 
 3. Risk associated with it

Objectives: 
 1.Understand Cross-Site Scripting(XSS) in Android application 
 2. Identify XSS 
 3.Vulnerable Code

Objectives: 
 1.Understand SQL Injection (Local)
 2. Identify SQL Injection 
 3. Vulnerable Code 
 4. Find all users.
 Note: Please complete 'Insecure Storage - SQLite' exercise and ensure minimum 2 users are created

Objectives: 
 1.Understand What is WebView 
 2. Access sensitive info using URL aprt from Web URL 
 3. Understand what is setAllowFileAccess for WebView

Objectives: 
 1. What is Shared Preferences? 
 2. Identify how/where sensitive information is stored 
 3. Vulnerable Code 
 4. Risk associated with it
In this exercise, we are going learn how data can be stored into Content Providers preferences.
Objectives:Go to Next Level by scoring 10000 points. \n Clicking on \'Score\' Button will give you 1 point. Don\'t click score button 10000 times

Objectives: 
 1. What is SQLite Database? 
 2. Identify how/where sensitive information is stored 
 3. Vulnerable Code 
 4. Risk associated with it
Objectives: \n 1. Identify how/where sensitive information is stored \n 2. Vulnerable Code

Objectives: 
 1. What is External Storage? 
 2. Identify how/where sensitive information is stored 
 3. Vulnerable Code 
 4. Risk associated with it

Objectives: 
 1. Understand what is Unprotected or Exportable Android component( Activity, Services and Broadcast Receivers) 
 2. Login without PIN verification by launching Activity 
 3. Understand Custom URL Scheme 
 4. Login using Custom URL Scheme (Without PIN Verification) 
 5. Download Invoice without PIN verification
Objectives: \n1. Find out how/where Promocode is hardcoded. \n2. Enter Promocode to get below product for free

Objectives: 
 1. Intercept HTTP Traffic 
 2. Intercept HTTPS Traffic in
 2.1 API 23 or below 
 2.2 API 24 or above 
 2.3 Understand network_security_config.xml 
 3. Understand and Bypass Certificate Pinning using different tools( Eg: JustTrustMe, TrustMeAlready, Frida, AppMon...etc)

Objectives: 
 1. What is Insecure Data Storage? 
 2. Understand different storage mechanism available 
 3. Identify how sensitive information is stored 
 4. Vulnerable Code 
 5.Risk associated with it

Objectives: 
 1. What is Side Channel Data Leakage? 
 2. Vulnerable Code 
 3. Risk associated with it
Objectives:Find where keystroke logs, for username and Password, saved in device
Objective: Get Access to Administration functionality

Objectives: 
 1. What is Clipboard? 
 2. Vulnerable Code 
 3. Risk associated with it
For any suggestions and feedback please satishkumarpatnayak@live.com
